problem.p: After you play the Pearls game here: http://www.transience.com.au/pearl3.html take a look at the following points. Check all that apply.

checkboxgroup.choice: The outcome of the Pearls game is dependent only on luck, i.e. there does not exist an algorithm that will guarantee a win everytime.
If both players are playing optimally, the player that plays first is guaranteed to win
If both players are playing optimally, the player that plays second is guaranteed to win
If both players are playing optimally, then the game will result in a tie
There exists a winning algorithm that depends on the number of pearls taken away
There exists a winning algorithm that depends on the number of pearls left on the board

div.p: In fact there exists a winning algorithm that guarantees that the first player will always win and the second player will always lose, given that both players are playing optimally. you may read up more on this algorithm here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nim
